learning_outcomes.description: critically assess the effectiveness of conventional and modern methods for diagnosing parasitic infections
describe the effect of resistance to anti-parasitic chemicals and drugs
critically assess the roles of molecular (e.g. PCR) and non-molecular (e.g. microscopy) tools in the clinic and the research laboratory
debate factors involved in the resurgence of parasitic diseases
describe the importance of a deep understanding of the life-cycle of a parasite in order to control that parasite

assessments.task_description:
In weeks 2 to 12 there will be an in-class, hand-written quiz at the beginning of the Wed lectorial (12pm to 2pm). Students who are unable to sit a quiz may apply for an extension to the quiz that will be held in week 13 at 1pm.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This practical quiz is scheduled for 90 mins in a School laboratory (76-224) during the semester. Students will attend workstations ("musical microscopes") to identify the parasite present and answering some questions about the specimens. 

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
The practical examination is scheduled for 60 mins in the School laboratories (76-224) during the central examination period. Students will play musical microscopes by attending workstations to identify the parasite present and answering some questions about the specimens. 

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
The theory examination is scheduled for two hours and students are required to answer four mini essay questions.

This will be an in-person, invigilated exam.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
